content.question: (a) Calculate the final temperature of the system consisting of the water, copper sphere, and the insulated aluminum container after they have reached thermal equilibrium. Begin your calculation by writing a fundamental physics principle or an equation from the reference booklet.

frqParts.text: (a) Calculate the final temperature of the system consisting of the water, copper sphere, and the insulated aluminum container after they have reached thermal equilibrium. Begin your calculation by writing a fundamental physics principle or an equation from the reference booklet.

The insulation from the aluminum container is now removed. The temperature of the air in the room is greater than the final equilibrium temperature of the copper, water, and aluminum container.(b) On the axes in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, sketch a graph of the rate of energy transfer <math alttext="the fraction Q over delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> through the walls of the aluminum container. A positive rate of energy transfer represents energy moving from the interior to the exterior of the aluminum container and a negative rate of energy transfer represents energy moving from the exterior to the interior of the aluminum container.

In Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the entire process of Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is repeated, with only the following changes:The aluminum container is filled with more water than Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.The insulation has been removed from the aluminum container.(c) Indicate whether the final temperature of the system consisting of the water, copper sphere, and aluminum container after they have reached thermal equilibrium will be greater than, less than or equal to the temperature calculated in part (a). Justify your answer by giving two reasons for the difference in final temperature.
